there is no way I can express how much I recommend Starship Troopers to anyone. It isn't anything like the movie, it's far more about politics, morality, and struggle than bugs eating people. Amazing book, you have to pick it up.
 
 Welcome to the boards, btw.
zachvac

My favorite book is "The Amber Spyglass" by Philip Pullman and it is the last in a trilogy. All 3 books are great but "The Amber Spyglass" is by far the best.
 
 Other favorites are:
 
 "Ender's game" and other books in that series
 
 "Summerland" - about baseball, of course I love it
 
 Anything by Vonnegut.
Ghost

What's the Amber Spyglass about?
 
 And yes, Ender's Game is an amazing book.
 
 Another of my favorite books I forgot to mention was 'Report From Engine Co. 82,' about an FDNY engine company in the south Bronx during times of turmoil. Of course, I'm biased, I'm in training to be a firefighter emoticon_cool

I like Tony Hillerman's mystery novels and Douglas Adams' Hitchihikers series. In the Time of Butterflies by Julia Alverez, The Poisonwood Bible by Barbara Kingsolver, and The Mists of Avelon by Marion Zimmer Bradley are other faves. Isabelle Allende is good, too - especially The House of the Spirits. Love Shakespeare's comedies.
